summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of Florida) to attorneys Jay P. Lefkowitz and Roy Black regarding the implementation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the selection of a Special Master and attorney representative, victim notifications, and the scope of the agreement regarding victims known to the government at different dates.

persons.name: Jay P. Lefkowitz
persons.context: Addressee of the letter, representing Jeffrey Epstein's interests in the Non-Prosecution Agreement implementation.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Addressee of the letter, co-counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the matter of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Non-Prosecution Agreement; referred to as the client of attorneys Lefkowitz and Black.

persons.name: Judge Davis
persons.context: The jointly-approved Special Master selected to oversee aspects of the Non-Prosecution Agreement implementation.

persons.name: Robert Josefsberg
persons.context: Attorney selected by the Special Master and accepted by both parties to serve as the attorney representative under the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: Mr. Goldberger
persons.role: Point of Contact for Civil Litigation
persons.context: Previously listed as the point of contact for civil litigation related to the case; the letter asks whether to continue listing him.

persons.name: Messrs. Goldberger and Tein
persons.context: Attorneys whose approval was previously obtained for victim notification letters; referenced regarding the format of future letters.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the letter, representing the U.S. Attorney's Office in correspondence about the Non-Prosecution Agreement implementation.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is an attorney representing Epstein in matters related to the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Black is an attorney representing Epstein in matters related to the Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Judge Davis, as Special Master, selected Robert Josefsberg to serve as the attorney representative.
Josefsberg serves as the attorney representative under the Non-Prosecution Agreement involving Epstein, with fees to be paid per the agreement.
Goldberger appears to be an attorney for Epstein, previously serving as point of contact for civil litigation.

events.title: Signing of Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: The Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein was signed.

events.title: Robert Josefsberg's Preparation
events.description: Robert Josefsberg expended time, effort, and funds preparing to serve as the attorney representative under the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Victim Knowledge Cut-off Date
events.description: A date referenced as a potential cut-off for victims known to the United States to be covered by the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Correspondence on NPA Implementation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter to Epstein's attorneys addressing implementation issues of the Non-Prosecution Agreement, including victim notifications and scope.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Ste 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
201 S. Biscayne Blvd, Suite 1300 Miami, FL 33131
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office is working to implement all terms of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Jeffrey Epstein.
A Special Master (Judge Davis) selected Robert Josefsberg as the attorney representative, and both parties accepted him.
The letter indicates the U.S. Attorney's Office previously provided victims with incorrect information, approved by Epstein's counsel, and now seeks to correct it promptly.
The scope of the NPA is debated: whether it covers victims known as of the signing (September 2007) or as of June 30, 2008, with implications for prosecution and victim compensation.
There is ongoing litigation between the United States and two of the victims mentioned, complicating efforts to modify or interpret the Agreement.
